container.heading: Maryland Occupational Safety and Health—Fall Protection in Steel Erection

section.heading: Scope.
section.text: This chapter applies to the steel erection activities set forth in 29 CFR §1926.750.

section.heading: Requirements.
section.text: Except for connectors and employees performing leading edge work in a controlled decking zone, fall protection requirements for employees performing steel erection activities, from a location between 10 feet up to and including 15 feet in height are provided for in 29 CFR §1926.28(a). Fall protection requirements for employees performing steel erection activities above 15 feet are provided for in Subpart R, 29 CFR §§1926.760 and 1926.761. Fall protection requirements for connectors and employees performing leading edge work in a controlled decking zone are provided for in Subpart R, 29 CFR §§1926.760 and 1926.761.

annotations.annotation: Labor and Employment Article, §§2-106(b)(4) and 5-312, Annotated Code of Maryland
Regulations .01—.03 repealed and new Regulations .01, .02 adopted effective September 30, 2002 (29:19 Md. R. 1524)
